definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Midnight is written by Mao Dun.
A series of explosions had rocked the Taj Mahal only despite midnight.
sentences.chinese: 子夜后，泰姬玛哈大酒店响起了一连串的爆炸声。

sentences.english: Just after midnight, the partners of 11 years were married.
sentences.chinese: 子夜刚过，这对11年来的有情人终成眷属。

sentences.english: Love is spending a few minutes together at midnight before Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 爱是在圣诞前夜的子夜一起度过的美好时光。

sentences.english: A few seconds after midnight on New Year’s Eve, 2010.

sentences.chinese: 我一直睡到子夜时醒了。

sentences.english: Dawn seemed to follow midnight with indecent haste.
sentences.chinese: 黎明追着子夜来临了，似乎匆忙得乱了阵脚。

sentences.english: But that amount of sleep dropped significantly for those in bed after midnight.
sentences.chinese: 但那些在子夜后睡觉的人的就寝时刻较着少很多。

sentences.english: I heard you’re supposed to kiss each other at midnight on New Year’s Eve.
sentences.chinese: 我听说除夕的子夜时刻你们应该互相亲吻。

sentences.english: Midnight was written by Mao Dun.
The divorce of Hugh and Miriam Halsworth becomes final at midnight.
sentences.chinese: 休和米丽亚姆子夜时分就要正式离婚了。

definition: late at night/in the dead of night
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
11 pm-1 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
Weiyang District of Xi’an 西安市[Xi1 an1 Shi4], Shaanxi
(literary) not ended/not yet over/close to the end
Li Yu (c. 937-978), given name of the final ruler of Tang of the Five Southern dynasties Li Houzhu 李後主|李后主, a renowned poet
9-11 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
old variant of 贏|赢[ying2], to win, to profit/old variant of 盈[ying2], full
